body: Well while I don't think security by obscurity has much of a value I don't thing exposure for no reason has a value either. What about something like "app" or `sha1($mainFoldername)` for defaults?
I am good with using what is defined in php.ini. Do you think that change will be possible without causing issues for existing applications?
Isnt that set only in cakephp/app anyway?

@markstory We will have to document the change in migration guide and existing apps will have to update their app config to keep old cookie name. That's why i propose making the change in 4.0

@dereuromark No the default cookie name is set in core's Session class.
This will simplify the use of third-party applications that work with CakePHP, and which use the cookie - "PHPSESSID" in their work.
Let's do it for 3.6 then, a small migration note on how to enable the former one (for existing applications that dont want to switch) with a single line of config on top should suffice.

issue.title: Error case reveals cake.css
issue.body:
`href="/css/cake.css"/>` can be found on 404 pages by default.
I think we should rename cake.css to sth like style.css to make it a bit less obvious that this is a cake app.

Refs https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/issues/11584

issue.title: Don't set session cookie name to CAKEPHP by default.

milestone.description:
4.0.0 is an *API breaking* release. It will:

* Remove the features deprecated in 3.x.

Code that works in the latest 3.x with no deprecation warnings should work in 4.0.0 as well.

See the roadmap for more information https://github.com/cakephp/cakephp/wiki/4.0-Roadmap
